meta_description: Visit the Trenton City Museum at Ellarslie Mansion in historic Cadwalader Park and experience exhibits showcasing Trenton’s vibrant history, industry, and culture.
hours_text:
# Visit

## Plan Your Visit to the Trenton City Museum

Nestled in Cadwalader Park, our museum offers all who visit an engaging mix of local and regional art, history, classes and community events. Come on in, and make yourself at home! 

Please sign our guest list when you visit; if you provide your email address, we will send you weekly updates on programming and events for all ages.

We look forward to welcoming you!

## Museum and Store Hours

Thursday – Saturday 12 to 4 pm  
Sunday 1 to 4 pm  
Closed on holidays

## Admission

Free entry to view all exhibitions and displays; donations gratefully welcomed.

## Directions

We are located in Ellarslie Mansion in Cadwalader Park in Trenton, NJ. Via GPS, use 299 Parkside Ave., Trenton, NJ 08618. Enter Cadwalader Park from Parkside Ave. and follow the signs; you will find ample parking along the roadway by the museum.

## Accessibility

Elevator serving all levels; accessible parking spots, and a stair-free side entrance.

## Tours

Contact us at [609-989-1191](tel:6099891191) or [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#26524b5566434a4a4754554a4f4308495441) to learn more.

## Molly’s Museum Store

Molly’s Museum Store—a great spot for unique, creative gifts and décor—is open during Museum hours and always available online.

[Visit The Store](/shop/)

## Plan Your Visit to the Trenton City Museum

Nestled in Cadwalader Park, our museum offers all who visit an engaging mix of local and regional art, history, classes and c...
admission_text:
# Membership

## Join the Trenton Museum Society or Renew Today

Our community-minded members include longtime Trentonians, area artists, dedicated volunteers, families, history buffs, and art lovers. If you are not a member yet, become one now!

[Mail-In Application](https://ellarslie.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/TMS_20Membership_20Form.pdf)

## Membership Benefits

Your membership provides vital support to your treasured museum, and provides benefits for you as well!

  * 10% off at Molly’s Museum Store for Individual, Family/Household, and Patron levels
  * 15% (10% for exhibition art sales) off at Molly’s Museum Store for Contributor, Donor, and Benefactor levels
  * Discounted or free admission to art talks and history lectures
  * Discounts on recitals and other performances, classes and workshops, and community events like the annual Sundaes on the Veranda and biennial Brunch & Blooms
  * Invitations to member events like opening receptions and exhibition previews
  * At the Patron level ($125) and up, discounts to other institutions in the North American Reciprocal Museum Association network

We also welcome sponsorships from businesses and organizations! Contact us at [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) or 609-989-1191 for details.

Donation Amount:

$ 75.00

  * $50 - Individual
  * $75 - Family/Household
  * $125 - Patron
  * $250 - Contributor
  * $500 - Donor
  * $1,000 - Benefactor

You have chosen to donate $75.00 once.

## Exhibitions

[ View All Exhibitions ](/exhibitions)

### New Jersey Photography Forum: Fall Is in the Air

On view through October 19, 2025

Celebrate autumn through 75 stunning photos by New Jersey Photography Forum artists. On view at the museum, Thurs–Sat 12–4, Sun 1–4. Free admission; donations welcome.

[Exhibition Details](https://ellarslie.org/exhibition/new-jersey-photography-forum-fall-is-in-the-air/)

### Mel Leipzig: The Revival of Realism

On view through January 4, 2026

Celebrate artist Mel Leipzig’s 90 years! Trenton City Museum will host exhibitions at Ellarslie and partner sites honoring his lasting impact on Trenton’s arts community. Stay tuned for details and share your stories with curator Joan Perkes.

[Exhibition Details](https://ellarslie.org/exhibition/mel-leipzig-the-revival-o...
